name: Newspapers and flyers
description: Clean newspapers, community papers and advertising flyers. Recycle loose with other paper.

name: Magazines and catalogues
description: All types of magazines and catalogues, including glossy ones.

name: Telephone books and directories
description: Phone books and similar paper directories. Hardcover books should be donated instead.

name: Office paper and envelopes
description: Writing paper, printer paper, notepads, plain and window envelopes. Shredded paper should be contained inside a paper bag or box.

name: Paper gift wrap and cards
description: Non-foil paper gift wrap and greeting cards without glitter or plastic parts.

name: Paper bags
description: Kraft grocery bags, paper prescription bags and paper envelopes that are not plastic or foil lined.

name: Corrugated cardboard boxes
description: Shipping boxes, moving boxes and pizza boxes (with minimal food residue). Flatten large boxes for collection.

name: Boxboard cartons
description: Cereal boxes, tissue boxes, cracker boxes and other thin cardboard packaging. Remove plastic liners.

name: Moulded paper packaging
description: Paper egg cartons, molded beverage trays and paper garden pots that are clean and empty.

name: Multi-layer paper food bags
description: Paper bags for flour, sugar and similar dry foods without foil or plastic layers.

name: Paper cups and lids
description: Disposable paper cups for hot or cold drinks. Empty and rinse. Lids go with container recycling; straws are garbage.

name: Gable-top drink cartons
description: Milk, cream and egg substitute cartons. Empty and rinse before recycling.

name: Aseptic soup and drink cartons
description: Shelf-stable cartons for soup, broth and sauces. Empty and rinse.

name: Frozen dessert cartons
description: Ice cream and frozen yogurt boxes. Empty and quickly scrape out food before recycling.

name: Plastic jugs with screw tops
description: Plastic jugs for milk, cooking oil, detergent, cleaners and windshield washer fluid. Empty and rinse.

name: Plastic bottles
description: Plastic bottles for food, dish soap, mouthwash, shampoo, conditioner and other household liquids. Empty and rinse; labels are fine.

name: Plastic jars and tubs
description: Plastic jars and tubs for peanut butter, jam, nuts, spreads, yogurt, cottage cheese, sour cream and ice cream. Empty and rinse.

name: Plastic clamshells
description: Clear hinged or lidded containers for baked goods, produce, fruit and eggs. Empty and rinse thoroughly.

name: Plastic trays and lids
description: Rigid plastic trays and tops for deli chicken, single-serve meals and hardware. Empty and rinse; no foam trays.

name: Microwavable plastic bowls and cups
description: Plastic bowls and cups for single-serve soups and ready meals. Remove lids and recycle both if clean.

name: Plastic cold drink cups
description: Take-out beverage cups made of rigid plastic. Empty and rinse; separate straws to garbage.

name: Plastic garden pots and trays
description: Plastic plant pots and seedling trays. Remove soil and plant material first.

name: Plastic pails under 25L
description: Pails for detergent, ice cream or pet food smaller than 25 L. Empty and rinse; remove metal handles if possible.

name: Non-durable plastic food containers
description: Lightweight plastic lunch containers and similar single-use food storage. Must be clean.

name: Plastic bags and overwrap (depot only)
description: Soft plastic bags for groceries, bread, produce, dry bulk foods and most frozen vegetables, plus outer wrap for diapers, flat-packed cans and large packages. Return clean and empty to a depot; not accepted in curbside carts.

name: Stand-up and zipper pouches (depot only)
description: Crinkly or stand-up pouches for frozen fruit, deli meats, grated cheese, snacks and detergents. Take clean pouches to a flexible-packaging depot.

name: Crinkly snack bags and wrappers (depot only)
description: Chip bags, candy bags and similar crinkly wrappers. Depot only; keep them out of curbside paper and container streams.

name: Bubble wrap and plastic air pillows (depot only)
description: Flexible plastic protective packaging from parcels, including bubble wrap and air cushions. Return to a depot with other flexible plastics.

name: Non-deposit glass bottles and jars
description: Clear or coloured glass food jars and bottles that do not carry a beverage deposit. Empty, rinse and remove lids.

name: White foam food trays and cups (depot only)
description: Clean foam meat trays, egg cartons, take-out containers, cups and bowls. Remove absorbent pads and food; sort by white vs coloured at the depot.

name: Coloured foam food trays and cups (depot only)
description: Coloured foam take-out containers, meat trays and cups that are clean and dry. Depot only.

name: Foam cushion packaging (depot only)
description: Rigid foam blocks and shapes used to protect electronics and small appliances in boxes. Remove tape and labels; recycle at a depot.

name: Steel food cans and lids
description: Steel cans for soup, vegetables, beans and pet food, plus cookie, tea and chocolate tins. Empty and rinse; labels can stay on.

name: Spiral wound cans and lids
description: Metal-ended cans for frozen juice concentrate, potato chips, coffee and baby formula. Empty completely before recycling.

name: Aluminum food cans
description: Aluminum cans and lids for seafood, pet food and similar items. Empty and rinse.

name: Aluminum foil and trays
description: Clean aluminum foil, pie plates and take-out trays. Rinse off food before recycling.

name: Empty aerosol cans
description: Completely empty aerosol cans for food, deodorant, hairspray, shaving cream and air freshener. Return partially full or paint aerosols to a hazardous waste program.
